"abstract": "

This map contains an example of all the features in a labyrinth in OLab v4.6. Created to test out the Duplicate function or advanced Export. Note that the Export/Import format being used here extends beyond what is permitted by the ANSI/Medbiq MVP standard. 

\n

See Author notes about what needs to be included, that was not included in 'Export testing 2'. Has been updated since some of the duplicates were made. Some items in this map are intended to illustrate what is known to survive an Export and what is known to be lost. e.g. Embedded Relative Links (see [Internally referenced node]) and Imagemaps. 

\n

 

",

"devNotes": "

**Authoring notes do not Import properly. They were Base64 encoded I think. They should have said this…

\n

Has one of everything that we want to Export/Import between OLab3 servers. This exceeds what can be covered in the ANSI/MVP format. 

\n

Check to see if all the internal and external refs work properly. Has been updated since some of the duplicates were made so some of them will not be identical. 

",
"feedback": "This is general feedback given to everyone",
"name": "IMPORT: Test: Duplicate and advanced export testing",

"description": "

This map contains an example of all the features in a labyrinth in OLab v4.6. Created to test out the Duplicate function or advanced Export. Note that the Export/Import format being used here extends beyond what is permitted by the ANSI/Medbiq MVP standard. 

\n

See Author notes about what needs to be included, that was not included in 'Export testing 2'. Has been updated since some of the duplicates were made. Some items in this map are intended to illustrate what is known to survive an Export and what is known to be lost. e.g. Embedded Relative Links (see [Internally referenced node]) and Imagemaps. 

\n

 

",

"annotation": "

Facilitator note: if you can see this panel, you are running in either Author or Reviewer mode. Users who are playing this case as Learners will not see the contents of these panels.??

\n

We use these panels for notes for teachers and for collaborative authoring notes while building a case.??

",

"info": "

This is an InfoButton - it should display in a separate panel.??

",

"text": "

The primary purpose of this labyrinth is to test whether Duplicate/Export/Import works satisfacorily for advanced OLab4 cases. 

\n

This case has not been prettified at all. This is just for testing portability of advanced functionality in OLab4 cases. 

\n

Note that the Export/Import format being used here extends beyond what is permitted by the ANSI/Medbiq MVP standard. 

",
"description": "Borrowed from Ron TT case for PNG as attached file",

Some items in this map are intended to illustrate what is known to survive an Export and what is known to be lost. e.g. Embedded Relative Links (see [Internally referenced node]) and Imagemaps.

\n

\n

",

tests["# messages are correct"] = functions.compareArraySize( jsonData.data.logMessages, 292 );
tests["# Questions is correct"] = functions.compareArraySize( jsonData.data, 5 );

"description": "

This is to remind authors that they are using the DEV server

",

"abstract": "

This case designed for testing other Export features. This was Duplicated from the original map 18, 'Export testing2'

\n

This is for testing of all items that matter to see what breaks.

\n

I have included all QUestion types but not all sub-parameters, scores, response details.

",

"devNotes": "

This was duplicated from the original map 18 on demo.olab3. The Duplicate function seemed to proceed smoothly. Some medial files were missing.

\n

Also added 7763 which has data in map_elements_metadata.

",
